Hitboxes on survivors are broken. killer can hit you from a far. you think for a game that came out in 2017 they'd fix something like this but instead they keep adding killers instead of fixing things that let the game actually be enjoyable.

everyone who main legion, micheal myers, and ghost face are hoes

The game is fun and yes that matters most. Sadly I'd never recommend this game to any of my friends. The character balancing for killers specifically is pretty bad. Several instances of horrible hit registration. Killers like Micheal Myers, The Nurse, and Nemesis are just a few that have some OP abilities when properly combo'd with certain perks. If you're only in it for the fun it's a decent game. If you're competitive and like comp play, stay away from this game...

this gotta be the biggest waste of time i have ever been apart of. I could watch the entire evolutionary process from amoeba to human and I would have a better time seeing a fish grow legs over a million years and it would be better than spending one minute just playing this game. They probably shut down Guantanamo Bay when they realized the prisoners were being forced to play this game.
Muy enviciante y depende como juegues podes subir rapido, yo llegue a level 10 con los asesinos y los survis en 122 horas, lo mejor es que son partidas rapidas.
its fun and addicting to play
This game is actually pretty technical, and enjoyable when hard work pays off.

As of 7/22/2022

The latest perk rework for this game somehow made the game more enjoyable. I play as a killer 90% of the time.
Of course, it isn't always 4 kills per session, there are really good mind game survivors and know what they are doing, they use team work at its best.
It might change, for the better or for the worse, but i will say this. Survivors can still win with at least one escaped or all escaped, i've had quite a few matches like that, but they were still fun (as of, harmed the survivors, got destruction points and chase points)

I don't know if the nerf of Dead Hard has made everything more enjoyable, even though the "Mini-Borrow Time" is now applied to every survivor. They still stand a chance.

In conclusion, my matches recentl;y have been very fun, and gave me inspiration to try out killers i thought of not trying because i'd get my ass handed to me easily.

I've played this game previously on PS4 and now I'm on PC again. On PS4 I logged around 70 hours... long story short nothing's changed, and I'm pissed. This game is severely unbalanced. Killers have reach, speed, and time to hook you that is unreasonable (even with things like wiggling). Unless you're "sweaty" the game essentially becomes a free kill for any killer. Friday the 13th still remains 100x better in terms of balancing in my opinion.
played it a bit. it's okay i guess
I can play as Nemesis from RE3, doesn't get much better than that
I recommend even though all of my friends thinks it's the Deval.

Really fun 4v1 game. You play as a Killer (1) or one of four Survivors. Killer has the objective to kill and survivors must complete gens and make it out alive. The community is pretty great, you will run into your fair share of toxicity on both sides. Whether its a 4 man survive with friends that t-bag, troll, and blind you constantly or a killer who sits and stares at your hanging body the entire match. However the matches you get where both are trying their best and being good sports are the best.

Despite a lot of the community being toxic and sweating their nuts off on either side (killer or survivor), this game still slaps pretty hard. Learning curve is kinda rough, especially if you're not used to asymmetrical game styles. Also, nothing really hits the spot like killing a survivor that's been a royal pain in the ass all match.

Overall 8/10, would kill again.
Playing as a survivor is the biggest waste of time ever. 1/5 people that play get to hack survivors to bits and the rest get to do quick time events until they get kicked back to lobby.

Been playing the game for a while on PS4. Got a PC recently and thought I'd pick it up on here. Gotta say, it's like a completely new experience. Highly recommend even if you've played on other platforms.
